meanings.definition: To cause distress or suffering to
meanings.sent1: Seeing his pet in pain aggrieves him deeply.
meanings.sent2: The loss of her favorite toy aggrieves the little girl.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to play with the new toy aggrieves the dog.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead aggrieves the mood of the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the song aggrieves the listener's heart.

meanings.sent1: His rude comment aggrieves his friend.
meanings.sent2: The unfair treatment aggrieves the employees.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous prank aggrieves the teacher but makes the students laugh.
meanings.sent4: The broken promise aggrieves her trust in him.
meanings.sent5: The harsh criticism aggrieves her self-esteem.
